p.span:
Beginning Monday, March 16th through Tuesday, June 16th, SAU 6 Schools will be conducting educational programming through Remote Learning.
All buildings and schools within the SAU district are closed.

a.title: Culinary Students at Chili Cook off and Culinary Student makes a cheese case

a.title: Students outdoors building a outdoor volcano

img.title: #bb2d36ecd3e5432a81f373713b199fdf
img.alt: Students outdoors building a outdoor volcano

div.p: 6-8 grade UES students participating with Major Maynard and FMUHS JROTC cadets

SAU #6 is comprised of two school districts, Claremont and Unity. Claremont School District has 3 elementary schools, a middle school, high school and regional technical center. Additionally, we have a preschool center and an adult learning center. Unity School District is a K-8 school.

br.br:
The purpose of this entry plan is to assist me in developing a comprehensive picture of SAU 6, including the students, staff and community stakeholders, that will help me to better understand the SAU (school system) and will lead to the creation of a report and specific recommendations. My plan will consist of interviews with various individuals and groups, as well as a review of plans and documents, in an effort to develop a sense of the SAU and provide a basis for future goals, objectives and activities. I plan to present a report to include findings and recommendations to the SAU 6 School Board and the community by February, 2020. I would also like to thank Dr. Bill Lupini, Superintendent of SAU 21, for his consultation and guidance and for allowing me to adapt and use his format and questions for use for all SAU 6 Boards, Stakeholders, and CBA groups.
Read the full plan here

a.title: CSB Public Hearing and Regular Meeting 5/6

div.a: CSB Public Hearing and Regular Meeting 5/6
div.div: May 6, 2020 at 6:30pm Televised Broadcast with Citizens Phone Call In (603) 543-4291 The Claremont School Board will be holding a televised broadcast with citizen call in Public Hearing to discuss donation of $8,877.67 for Stevens High School Library from NH Charitable Foundation and transfer of funds from the Special Education Trust Fund to the FY21 Budget. Due to covid-19 and the health and safety of our residents, this meeting will only be televised with citizens having the ability to call in with questions or comments. A regular School Board Meeting to immediately follow. Please visit the Claremont School Board webpage to review agenda items. The public is encouraged to watch the televised broadcast and call in during citizens comments.
div.a: Read More About CSB Public Hearing and Regular Meeting 5/6

div.div: As a follow-up on the Governor Sununu’s 2 pm press conference on April 16, 2020 in which he directed that all schools will continue remote learning for the remainder of this school year, students will not be reporting back to school for the remainder of this year. Additionally, the NHIAA has also announce the cancellation of the spring sports season. These are truly challenging and uncertain times, but know that all of us at SAU 6 remain focused on educating your sons and daughters for the remainder of the school year and we will be keeping you updated on a weekly basis. Please continue to monitor the SAU 6 Remote Learning Webpage for updates at: https://sites.google.com/sau6.…/claremontremotelearning/home
div.a: Read More About April 16, 2020 COVID-19 Remote Learning Update

a.title: Unity School District Annual Meeting Postponed

div.a: Unity School District Annual Meeting Postponed
div.div: The May 2, 2020 Unity School District Annual Meeting has been postponed to August 2020 with the date and time TBD.

div.div: Please see the March 6, 2020 NH DHHS Health Alert for updated information about COVID-19. For more information about COVID-19, please watch the March 4, 2020 Dartmouth video presentation. Please read more to access links.

div.span: Kindergarten pre-registration begins Monday, February 3, 2020, for all incoming kindergarten Claremont students for the 2020-2021 school yea

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

div.span: r. In order for your child to qualify for kindergarten, you must be a Claremont resident and your child must be 5 years old by September 30, 2020.
